sentence.Network_en: My audience certainly isn't the proverbial man in the street.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的观众当然不是街上的平头百姓。

sentence.Network_en: The offending comment was in fact a heckle from an audience member.
sentence.Network_cn: 这番冒犯性的话实际上是一名观众的诘难。

sentence.Network_en: They would always come out and warm up the audience.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们总是会出来调动观众情绪。

受众（audience）　　指的是信息的接收者，不论载体是对话、书籍、电视或其他媒介。因此受众可能是观众、读者、听众或观察者。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French, from Latin audientia, from audire 'hear'

entry.def: The audience at a play, concert, film, or public meeting is the group of people watching or listening to it.

example.ex: The entire audience broke into loud applause...
example.tran: 全场观众爆发出热烈的掌声。

example.ex: He was speaking to an audience of students at the Institute for International Affairs.
example.tran: 他在国际事务学院给学生们作演讲。

entry.tran: （电视或广播节目的）观众，听众
entry.def: The audience for a television or radio programme consists of all the people who watch or listen to it.

example.ex: The concert will be relayed to a worldwide television audience estimated at one thousand million.
example.tran: 这场音乐会将向全球约10亿电视观众转播。

entry.def: The audience of a writer or artist is the people who read their books or look at their work.

example.ex: Say's writings reached a wide audience during his lifetime...
example.tran: 在塞伊有生之年，他的作品拥有大量的读者。

example.ex: She began to find a receptive audience for her work.
example.tran: 她开始为作品寻找知音。

entry.def: If you have an audience with someone important, you have a formal meeting with them.

example.ex: The Prime Minister will seek an audience with the Queen later this morning.
example.tran: 今天上午晚些时候首相将会觐见女王陛下。

means.word_mean: 1. a gathering of spectators or listeners at a (usually public) performance;

sentences.sentence: "someone in the audience began to cough"

means.word_mean: 2. the part of the general public interested in a source of information or entertainment;

sentences.sentence: "the broadcast reached an audience of millions"

means.word_mean: 3. an opportunity to state your case and be heard;

sentences.sentence: "he saw that he had lost his audience"
"he had a consultation with the judge"
"he requested an audience with the king"

Sentence.sentence: But because you can't drive a car and watch television at the same time, rush hour became radio's prime, while music, talk, and news radio greatly enlarged their audiences.
The subjects who had an audience did worse than the subjects who did alone.
Social psychologist, John Roberts, finally cleared up the confusion about why people sometimes perform better and sometimes worse in front of an audience
He positioned the table so that he could move close to the audience that's the strategic point in the speech.
The purpose of the speech was to encourage the audience of corporate executives and local business owners to support local sports groups
Realizing that this particular audience would find his regional accent unattractive, Larry planned to speak with an accent that would be more acceptable to his audience.

means.word_mean: 观众, 听众; 读者

sentences.en: The audience has expressed its approval.
The audiences are requested to be their seats by ７ ∶ ２５.
She felt nervous at having to sing before such a large audience.
sentences.cn: 为这么多听众演唱, 她感到很紧张。

sentences.en: Each style or form has its own audience.
sentences.cn: 每一种格调或形式各有其拥护者。

jushi.english: The audiences are requested to be their seats by 7：25.
She felt nervous at having to sing before such a large audience.
jushi.chinese: 为这么多听众演唱,她感到很紧张。

jushi.english: The representatives were given an audience at the meeting.
jushi.chinese: 会议上给了代表们发表意见的机会。
